series.system.estimation.masked.data 0.0.0.9000

    Example of how to use series.system.estimation.masked.data package

Function reference

All functions

confint(<md_mle>)
Method to obtain the confidence intervals of the parameter values of a masked data estimator, md_estimate.
exp_series_data_1
Masked data for a series system with exponentially distributed components
exp_series_data_2
Masked data for a 5-out-of-5 (series) system with exponentially distributed nodes.
exp_series_data_3
Masked data for a 10-out-of-10 (series system) with exponentially distributed nodes.
exp_series_data_4
Masked data for a 3-out-of-3 (series system) with exponentially distributed nodes.
exp_series_data_5
Masked data for a 3-out-of-3 (series) system with exponentially distributed nodes.
fisher_info(<exp_dist>)
Method to obtain the fisher information of the x object that represents an exp_dist object.
fisher_info(<md_mle>)
Method to obtain the fisher information matrix of an md_mle.
hazard()
Generic method for obtaining the hazard function of a random variable.
hazard(<exp_dist>)
Method to obtain the hazard function of an exp_dist object.
hazard(<exp_series_dist>)
Method to obtain the hazard function of an exp_series_dist object.
make_exp_dist()
Construct exponential distribution object.
make_exp_series_dist()
Construct exponential series object.
make_normal()
Construct (multivariate or univariate) normal distribution object.
md_candidate_m1()
Candidate model m1
md_exp_series_component_failure_reg_cand
Constructs a pdf (pmf) object for the conditional probability of component failure Pr{Ki=j|Ci=ci,Ti=ti) = h_j(ti)/h(ti) I(j in ci)}. in an exponential series system for the regular candidate model. md_exp_series_component_failure_reg_cand(theta) thetaparameter value of exp_series_dist Constructs a pdf (pmf) object for the conditional probability of component failure Pr{Ki=j|Ci=ci,Ti=ti) = h_j(ti)/h(ti) I(j in ci)}. in an exponential series system for the regular candidate model.
md_info_exp_series_reg_cand()
Information matrix (observed) for rate parameter with respect to masked data of a series system with exponentially distributed lifetimes and the regular candidate model.
md_loglike_exp_series_reg_cand()
Log-likelihood for masked data with candidate sets obeying the regular candidate set model for exponential series system.
md_maked_data_exp_series_dist_reg_cand()
Generates masked data for a series system with exponentially distributed nodes and candidate sets according to candidate_model.
md_num_comp()
Method for obtaining the number of nodes in an object.
md_reg_cand()
Regular candidate model
md_score_exp_series_reg_cand()
score function of masked data for a series system with exponentially distributed lifetimes.
md_series_component_failure_decorator()
Decorate masked data (tbl_md) with component failure probabilities.
md_series_component_failure_decorator_diff()
Decorate masked data md with a some measure of the difference between component failure probabilities.
params(<exp_dist>)
Method for obtaining the parameters of a exp_dist distribution object.
params(<normal>)
Method for obtaining the parameters of a normal object.
params(<series>)
Method for obtaining the parameters of a series distribution object.
pdf()
Generic method for obtaining the pdf function of a random variable.
pdf(<exp_dist>)
Method to obtain the pdf of an exp_dist object.
pdf(<exp_series_dist>)
Method to obtain the pdf of an exp_series_dist object.
point(<md_mle>)
Method to obtain the point estimate of a masked data estimator, md_mle.
sampler(<exp_dist>)
Method to sample from an exp_dist object.
sampler(<exp_series_dist>)
Method to sample from an exp_series_dist object.
sampler(<md_mle>)
Method to obtain the sampler for an md_mle object.
sampler(<normal>)
Method for sampling from a normal object.
series.system.estimation.masked.data
series.system.masked.data: A package for estimating series system component lifetime parameters from masked data
vcov(<exp_dist>)
Method for obtaining the variance of a exp_dist object.
vcov(<exp_series_dist>)
Method for obtaining the variance-covariance of a exp_series_dist object.
vcov(<md_mle>)
Compute the covariance matrix from the given masked data estimate.
vcov(<normal>)
Retrieve the variance-covariance matrix (or scalar) of a normal object.
